definition: thoroughfare/to go straight ahead/to rush/to clash
(of water) to dash against/to mix with water/to infuse/to rinse/to flush/to develop (a film)/to rise in the air/to clash/to collide with
"ice" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 15), occurring in 冰[bing1], 次[ci4] etc, known as 兩點水|两点水[liang3 dian3 shui3]
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)
conflict/to conflict/clash of opposing forces/collision (of interests)/contention
variant of 衝擊|冲击[chong1 ji1]
to attack/to batter/(of waves) to pound against/shock/impact
variant of 衝擊|冲击[chong1 ji1]
to attack/to batter/(of waves) to pound against/shock/impact
to have an urge/to be impetuous/impulse/urge

sentences.english: She gives me a big smile every time she sees me.
sentences.chinese: 她每次看见我都冲我热情地笑笑。

sentences.english: The travellers were dismayed to find the bridge had been wash away.
sentences.chinese: 旅行者们发现桥被冲跑了，很沮丧。

sentences.english: We also use instant tea and coffee.
sentences.chinese: 他们也喜欢喝马上冲马上喝的茶和咖啡。

sentences.english: He hated the way I called him out.
sentences.chinese: 他其实很讨厌我那样冲他嚷。

sentences.english: It was my neighbor’s wife! I rushed in without hesitation.
sentences.chinese: 原来是我邻居的妻子在叫唤，我毫不犹豫的冲了过去。

sentences.english: He swilled his room out with antiseptic.
Earlier today, he even made her a cup of tea, which still appears to be a novelty for all involved.
sentences.chinese: 今早他甚至为妈妈冲了一杯茶，这实在是前所未有。

sentences.english: If we minimize rise time we increase overshoot, and viceversa.
sentences.chinese: 如果我们减少上升时间，也就增加了过冲，反之亦然。

sentences.english: They will charge you fifty dollars for a half-hour, and you won't be able to windsurf.
sentences.chinese: 他们半小时收费五十元，你根柢冲不起来。

sentences.english: We are on the train from Xi'an to Tianshui.
sentences.chinese: 我们正在乘搭火车冲从西安到天水。

sentences.english: You don't have to bite my head off. I'm just quoting Julia.
sentences.chinese: 你不需要冲我发火，我不过是在引用朱莉娅的话。

sentences.english: He drove the police car at full throttle and dashed at the gangsters.
sentences.chinese: 他驾驶着警车开足马力向匪徒冲去。

sentences.english: Because of the river's left depositing and right scouring, the Xianfenzhou merged to the left bank becoming frontage.
sentences.chinese: 仙峰洲则因河道左淤右冲而并于左岸成为边滩。

sentences.english: Look! The little boy is making faces at us.
sentences.chinese: 瞧，那个小男孩在冲我们做鬼脸。

sentences.english: Don't swill the tealeaves out into the sink.
For the past 30 years or more, great changes of scouring and deposition have taken place at the Zhenyang Reach in the Changjiang River.
sentences.chinese: 三十多年来，长江镇扬河段发生了巨大的冲淤变化。

definition: (of a person) to turn round/to face about/(of a widow) to remarry (archaic)
to kill/to murder/to attack/to weaken or reduce/to smart (dialect)/(used after a verb) extremely
to turn one's head/to turn around
to turn round/to turn one's head/later/by and by
to turn one's head/to change direction/U-turn/volte face/to repent
nutation (plants turning to face the sun)
